availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew H. Clark (Owsley County, Kentucky, colonel (U.S.A.))

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Clark. Married to Luvenia Rains Clark in Clark County, Kentucky on December 24, 1867. Farmer in Owsley County, Kentucky in 1860. Promoted to Lieutenant Colonel in the 47th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) on October 20, 1863. Promoted to Colonel on December 21, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 459.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, p.307.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley, Booneville, p. 322A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clay County Marriages, Film #001904623, p.184.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 440.
